smell_analysis.justification: No empty diagrams were found. The PDF pages that appear to be diagrams (use-case, activity, class, state, database-style class) all show named elements and content.

No unambiguous use case oval without an associated actor is explicitly visible in the parsed content of the use-case diagrams on pages labeled 'uc Autode funktsionaalne allsüsteem (Vaata & Tuvasta)' and 'uc Autode halduse funktsionaalne allsüsteem (Muuda)'. Since associations are not explicitly shown in the text, and the rule requires clear visibility, no violation is confirmed.

The use-case names visible appear to describe distinct activities (e.g., 'Registreeri auto', 'Aktiveeri auto', 'Lõpeta auto', 'Unusta auto', 'Vaata aktiivseid autosid'). There is no explicit pair of differently named use cases describing the same activity with the same actor.

In the package-style overview on page 1, the listed elements within each register/package do not show clear duplicate primary names within the same package. Repeated classifier-type metadata text is explicitly excluded by the rules. No violation is explicitly visible.

The database/table pages (e.g., pages 14-19) do not explicitly show two or more tables storing redundant copies of the same data value without a Foreign Key connection. Identically named common fields are not sufficient evidence, and no explicit denormalized duplicates are shown.

Within each visible use-case diagram, the use cases consistently appear to start with action verbs in Estonian, such as 'Tuvasta', 'Vaata', 'Registreeri', 'Muuda', 'Aktiveeri', 'Unusta', 'Lõpeta'. No inconsistent form within a single use-case diagram is explicitly shown.

The state diagram 'Auto seisundidiagramm' shows multiple states (e.g., 'Ootel', 'Aktiivne', 'Mitteaktiivne', 'Lõpetatud', 'Unustatud') and transitions in the visual content, but the parsed text does not provide explicit evidence of an unreachable state. With no unambiguous unreachable state visible, no violation is confirmed.

The activity diagram 'Auto lõpetamise tegevusdiagramm' includes actions such as 'Vaata kõiki autosid...', 'Otsi autot', 'Vali auto', 'Lõpeta valitud auto'. The text does not explicitly show any action that is unreachable. Therefore, no violation is confirmed.

The class diagrams appear to show multiplicities (e.g., '1', '0..*', '0..1') where relationships are listed, and the database-style diagrams use FK notation that is exempt under the interpretation rules. No UML-style relationship lacking multiplicities at both ends is explicitly visible.

No single identified diagram clearly displays 10 or more central elements. The use-case diagrams show fewer than 10 use cases; the state diagram shows around five named states; class and database pages show under 10 central classes/tables per page.

No single class/table on a single diagram is explicitly shown with 6 or more distinct visible relationship lines. Based on the listed relationships and FK connectors per page, connection counts appear below the threshold, and no explicit six-line hub is visible.

The PDF does not provide explicit measurable evidence that the distance between two related elements is more than twice the average distance on any diagram. Without unambiguous visual confirmation, this rule is not triggered.

The visible use-case names start with active verbs (e.g., 'Tuvasta kasutaja', 'Vaata aktiivseid autosid', 'Registreeri auto', 'Muuda autot'). The activity actions also appear to start with verbs where named. No clear violation is explicitly visible.

At least one attribute/column name appears to be 3 or fewer characters, such as 'vin' in the Auto class attribute list (pages 11-12) and in the Auto table column list (pages 17-18). This explicitly meets the rule threshold for being too short.

Visible class names such as 'Isik', 'Töötaja', 'Auto', 'Klient', 'Kasutajakonto', and classifier-related classes appear to start with uppercase letters and are not clearly pluralized singular-domain classes. No explicit violation is visible.

Attribute/column names shown in class and database diagrams (e.g., 'eesnimi', 'perenimi', 'isikukood', 'on_aktiivne', 'reg_number') appear to start with lowercase letters. No attribute/column starting with an uppercase letter is explicitly visible.

Database table names visible (e.g., 'Isik', 'Kasutajakonto', 'Klient', 'Auto', 'Riik', 'Auto_mark', 'Auto_kategooria') do not clearly appear as plural forms. No explicit plural table naming violation is visible.

No class, table, or attribute names visibly use type-indicating prefixes such as 'tbl_', 'uc_', or 'str'. Allowed PK_/FK_-style prefixes appear only as constraint/metadata labels in database notation. No explicit violation is shown.
